docs.title: Motorola G54/G64 (cancunf) Guides
docs.text:
Hii there, Welcome to the documentations and guides page for cancunf

  • Follow the instructions with patience.

  • Have a great day :)

docs.title: Available Documentations
docs.text:
• Bootloader Unlock
  • Custom ROM Flashing
  • Fix empty slots
  • Downgrade

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
To follow along the upcoming procedures you need

  • A Personal Computer (PC)
  • Platform Tools
  • Moto USB Drivers
  • Patience

docs.title: Step 1: Get Moto USB Drivers
docs.text:
• Download Motorola USB Drivers from here
  • Then install them

docs.title: Step 2: Setup platform tools
docs.text:
• Download the platform tools from Here
  • Locate the downloaded archive and extract it
  • Open a command prompt in platform-tools folder
  • Open the platform-tools folder
  • Click on the URL bar of the file explorer
  • Type cmd and press Enter
  • It will open a command prompt window like below

docs.title: 1. Enable OEM Unlocking
docs.text: • Turn on OEM Unlocking in Settings/Developer Options

docs.title: 2. Sign in to motorola
docs.text: • Open Motorola Website using this link and Sign in

docs.title: 3.Booting to Booloader mode
docs.text:
• Reboot to bootloader mode using any of the two methods given below

  • Method 1: Power off the device and hold the volume down and power buttons simultaneously.

  • Method 2: Connect your phone to PC via an USB Cable
    • Open command prompt in platform-tools folder (Step 2)
    • Type - 
      adb reboot bootloader
    • and hit enter

The phone would ultimately boot to a screen like below

  • Connect your phone to PC if you haven't

docs.title: 4.Retrieve Unlock Information
docs.text:
• Open a command prompt if not opened (Step 2)
  • Type the command given below and hit enter 
    fastboot oem get_unlock_data
    You will see output similar to this:
(bootloader) 0A40040192024205#4C4D3556313230
(bootloader) 30373731363031303332323239#BD00
(bootloader) 8A672BA4746C2CE02328A2AC0C39F95
(bootloader) 1A3E5#1F53280002000000000000000
(bootloader) 0000000
  • Copy Unlock Data
  • Combine these lines into one continuous string without "bootloader" or spaces. e.g., 0A40040192024205#4C4D355631323030373731363031303332323239#BD008A672BA4746C2CE02328A2AC0C39F951A3E5#1F532800020000000000000000000000

docs.title: 5.Submit unlock data
docs.text:
• Paste the combined string on the site you logged into earlier.
  • Click "Can my device be unlocked?" and agree to the terms
  • You will receive an unlock key via email.

docs.title: 6. Unlock Bootloader
docs.text:
• After receiving the unlock key do the following
  • In the command prompt type 
    fastboot oem unlock <your_received_key>
  • Replace with the unlock code from the email
  • Confirm the unlock on your phone via power buttons

    • Congratulations!!

    Your bootloader has been unlocked successfully

docs.title: Flashing custom recovery and custom ROMs
Flashing Recovery
docs.text:
• Download your recovery image from your preferred rom post and place it in platform-tools folder
  • Boot your device to bootloader mode
  • Flash the recovery image
    • Type the below command in command prompt and hit enter to flash the custom recovery.
fastboot flash vendor_boot vendor_boot.img

Info

Attach vendor_boot.img in place of vendor_boot.img

docs.title: Method 1
docs.text:
• Type the below command in command prompt and hit enter to reboot into recovery mode
fastboot reboot recovery

docs.title: Method 2
docs.text:
• Enter fastboot mode.
  • Use the volume key to select Recovery and press power button to boot into recovery.

The phone will reboot into recovery mode and will look like something this

docs.title: Flashing ROM
docs.text:
Warning

Make sure that any slot must not be empty, means if u have ever used blankflash or flashed stock ROM using RSA then make sure u got any ota. Else don't flash.

  • Download the ROM:

    • Download the ROM of your choice. Verify the MD5 checksum to verify package integrity.

  • Format Data

Info

You must format data if you are flashing for the first time or switching roms

  • Apply Update in Recovery:
    • Boot into recovery mode.
    • Select "Apply update" opton.

  • Choose Update Source:

  • Select either pendrive, external SD card, or ADB sideload.

    • for ADB sideload, type 
      adb sideload <rom.zip>
    • Replace <rom.zip> with the filename you downloaded, and hit Enter.
    • for external storage, navigate to the location of the downloaded file and flash.

  • Flash ROM:

    • The process will proceed to 47% and then ask if you want to reboot to flash additional packages. Select "Yes" or "No". It doesn't matter what you choose.

  • Reboot to System

    • Reboot your phone to the system.

Congratulations!!

Your new custom ROM has been installed.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Tiny fastboot script: Download
  • A suitable device firmware: Download
  • Moto flash pro utility: Download

Info

You can downgrade from A15 to A14. Don't try to go below May patch because anti-rollback will not allow you to downgrade.

warning

You are doing it at your own risk, so you must bear the burden of any repercussions that follow.

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
• Download A14 firmware file from Lolinet or any other source.

  • Flash it using tiny fastboot script or moto flash pro or manually by typing the commands.

  • Now, if you want to flash custom rom then do an OTA.

Update

Jan patch is supported now.

docs.title: Fix empty slot issue in Moto G54 5G
Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Tiny fastboot script: Download
  • Your device firmware (a version older than the one you wish to be): Download

Info

Verify the software channel of your device and download the firmware accordingly.

docs.title: Check if you have an Empty slot
docs.text:
• Connect your device with a PC in fastboot mode.
  • Open command prompt Type the following command and hit enter
fastboot getvar all

You will get output about slot informations, like this

(bootloader) slot-successful:_a: yes

(bootloader) slot-successful:_b: no

(bootloader) slot-unbootable:_a: no

(bootloader) slot-unbootable:_b: yes
  • Check the lines with slot_unbootable
  • If it says "yes" then you need to fix it

docs.title: Fixing of empty slot(s)
docs.text:
To fix empty slot, follow the steps below:

  • Extract both Tiny Fastboot Script and Firmware in the same folder.

  • Run flash.bat

  • Use the default bootloader version (1st option)

  • Press 5 to flash full firmware and factory reset.

  • Wait for the process to complete.
  • Reboot your device into system and complete the setup process.
  • Go to settings and check for system update.
  • Install the update and reboot your device.

Enjoy Flashing

Now both of your slots are filled and you can install Custom ROM without any issues.
